Name: Second stela for the seal-bearer Seneb
Description: The surface is framed by in incised motif that imitates a torus moulding. It is divided into seventeen smaller units each with a standing figure and one or more vertical columns of text, which contain the offering formula and the name of the depicted. In the lunette and between the inscriptions, a standing Osiris with was-sceptre and a jackal on a standard are facing each other. The representations are only incised. None of the figures have any inner details nor have they been polished.
